title: Welcome
text:
This is a companion for DuckDB in Action by Mark Needham, Michael Hunger, and Michael Simons (Manning, copyright 2024, 9781633437258).
Each chapter title to the left is a link to a slide deck.

These slides are being developed by this club.
Each deck will open in its own tab.
You may want to type “s” at the start of each deck to open the speaker notes.
Join the Data Science Learning Community to participate in the discussion!

We follow the Data Science Learning Community Code of Conduct.

title: Club meetings
text:
Book club meetings

Volunteer leads discussion of a chapter

This is the best way to learn the material.

Presentations:

Review of material
Questions you have
Maybe live demo

More info about editing: this github repo
Recorded, available on the Data Science Learning Community YouTube Channel (DSLC.video)

title: Club meetings
text:
Pace

Goal: 1 chapter/week
Ok to split overwhelming chapters
Ok to combine short chapters
Meet every week except holidays, etc

We will meet even if scheduled presenter unavailable
Push to finish before Daylight Savings Madness March 8

title: Club meetings
text:
Learning objectives (LOs)

Students who study with LOs in mind retain more
Tips:

Think “After today’s session, you will be able to {LO}”
Very roughly 1 per heading

title: Club meetings
text:
Group introductions

If you feel comfortable sharing:

Who are you?
Where you calling in from? (If you’re not comfortable sharing, skip)
How long have you been using R?
What was your introduction to R?
What are you most looking forward to during the club?
